title: Featured hero image for Major Projects page

requirements.summary: Add a featured image section to the Major Projects (/projects) page between the intro block and projects grid, matching existing hero image styling.
acceptanceCriteria: Visiting "/projects" shows a featured image between the heading/intro text and the list of ProjectCard items.
The image uses consistent styling with other page hero images (rounded-lg, shadow-lg, object-cover, centered with max width).
The image has an English alt text that describes the visual content.
The rest of the Major Projects content and layout (project list/grid) remains intact and renders correctly.

file_operations.description: Insert a new featured image block between the existing title/intro section and the projects grid, using the same responsive styling pattern used on Services and Major Clients pages (w-full, max-w-5xl, mx-auto, rounded-lg, shadow-lg, object-cover). Reference the new static asset via an absolute public path and include a descriptive English alt text.

requirements.summary: Add the new Major Projects featured image as a static public asset under the generated assets folder and reference it via an absolute path.
acceptanceCriteria: A new image file exists in the frontend public assets (under the generated assets folder) matching the filename specified in Image Requirements.
MajorProjectsPage references the image via a public path (e.g., "/assets/generated/<filename>") and the image loads in the browser in production builds.

file_operations.description: Add the required hero image asset (wide hero photo of an active electrical worksite with electricians in PPE, visible switchgear/cable trays, industrial/commercial setting, warm neutral tones, realistic photography style) as a static file so it can be served directly from the public assets folder.

Update/ensure the featured image uses the absolute public path "/assets/generated/major-projects-hero.dim_1600x900.jpg" (not routed through the backend) and confirm it renders correctly in production builds.
